page.title: 07BEACH BROTHERS,EXETER.
page.content: Beach Brothers is a small factory owned by two brothers. The business began in Dover in the last century but it then came to Exeter in 1940 when they took over the building in Western Road,St.Thomas. 50 people are working there. They make things from wood such as bungs for barrels. They make 1,500,000 a year! They sell floor tiles of all sorts and special adhesives to shops and tradesmen all over the South of England. They have their own lorries as well. The wood is brought from U.S.A and is of a special type called red gumwood. The factory has machines for planing wood and for cutting the bungs. Even the shavings and the sawdust are kept and sold for horse litter and butchers shop floors. Their wood drying kilns are used by double glazing suppliers for their wooden window parts.
